problem_summary_simple: Determine which child has the ball after k seconds, given a bouncing ball movement pattern.
problem_summary_technical: Simulates ball movement with direction changes at ends. Uses modulo arithmetic to find the final position efficiently.
key_insights: The ball's movement is cyclical with a period of 2 * (n - 1) seconds.
The direction of movement depends on how many full cycles (n-1 steps) have been completed.
Modulo operation simplifies finding the position within a cycle.
The movement pattern repeats every 2*(n-1) seconds.
The position after k seconds can be found by considering k modulo 2*(n-1).
The direction of movement depends on the quotient of k divided by (n-1).
